Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {readosense: Imports Log and Data Files from Eosense Flux Chambers},   author = {Joseph Gaudard},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://jogaudard.github.io/readosense}, }

what: Imports Log and Data Files from Eosense Flux Chambers
title: Imports Log and Data Files from Eosense Flux Chambers
text: readosense R package provides easy way import raw files Eosense ecosystem gas flux chambers R objects can used Fluxible package.

title: Imports Log and Data Files from Eosense Flux Chambers
text: can install development version readosense GitHub :

title: Imports Log and Data Files from Eosense Flux Chambers
code: library(readosense)  # this step is not needed if you know where your data are path_logs <- system.file("extdata/ex_logs", package = "readosense")  logs <- eo_import_logs(path_logs)  chamber_log <- eo_logs(logs)  env_variables <- eo_env(logs)

title: Imports Log and Data Files from Eosense Flux Chambers
code: # this step is not needed if you know where your data are path_data <- system.file("extdata/ex_data", package = "readosense")  data <- eo_data(path_data)   # it is more practical to join the environmental data here  data <- data |>   dplyr::left_join(env_variables, by = dplyr::join_by(f_datetime == datetime))

title: Imports Log and Data Files from Eosense Flux Chambers
text: first step fluxible workflow look like :
code: library(fluxible)  conc <- flux_match(   raw_conc = data,   field_record = chamber_log,   f_datetime = f_datetime,   start_col = closing,   end_col = opening,   fixed_length = FALSE )

what: imports log files from Eosense chambers — eo_import_logs
title: imports log files from Eosense chambers — eo_import_logs
imports log files from Eosense chambers — eo_import_logs
code: eo_import_logs(   path,   closed = c(1:3),   open = 0,   fully_closed = 1,   colnames = c("port", "valvestatus", "chamberstatus", "aux1", "aux2", "aux3", "aux4",     "aux5", "temperaturev", "pressure"),   nb_ports = 12 )

title: imports log files from Eosense chambers — eo_import_logs
text: path folder log files located closed status numbers indicating chamber closed open status numbers indicating chamber open fully_closed status number indicating chamber fully closed colnames column names defined Eosense documentation nb_ports number ports
